No data is 100% safe, but we do our best to optimize the security of the app by encryption, not asking for obsolete data and provide you avatar pictures.
What is a meditation and gratitude journal app and how does it work?
How can meditation and gratitude journaling improve my mental health and wellbeing?
Is it possible to track my progress and see improvements in my mental state over time?

Introducing Tara, the mental health app designed to guide you on your journey towards emotional wellness. Named after the goddess of compassion, this app is designed to help those struggling with mental health issues by providing a range of tools to improve emotional well-being. Tara features an animation of a glowing lotus that serves as a guide for breathing exercises to help you relax and focus. In addition, the app provides daily healthy positivity affirmations to encourage a positive outlook on life. And in case of an emotional emergency, the app offers an emergency call button for immediate help. One of the standout features of Tara is the gratitude journal, which encourages users to document happy moments in their life and slowly shift their focus towards positivity. By reflecting on the good things in life, users can cultivate a sense of gratitude and appreciation, which can have a positive impact on overall mental health. The inspiration behind the creation of Tara comes from the loss of friends to depression, anxiety, and suicide. The founder of the app knows that there is no guarantee that Tara will solve all mental health issues, but she hopes that the app can make a positive impact on the world and help at least a little bit. With Tara, users can take proactive steps towards improving their mental health and emotional well-being.

To cover data storage and the service we provide you, as well as feed our developers (they become wild beasts without pizza and Coke ðŸ˜‚), we are forced to request a subscription fee from you. But, please, be assured we try our best to keep it as low as possible.
